case_vignette:
A 35-year-old man presents with yellow discoloration of his eyes and skin for the past week. He also says he has pain in the right upper quadrant for the past few days. He is fatigued constantly and has recently developed acute onset itching all over his body. The patient denies any allergies. Past medical history is significant for ulcerative colitis diagnosed 2 years ago, managed medically. He is vaccinated against hepatitis A and B and denies any recent travel abroad. There is scleral icterus present, and mild hepatosplenomegaly is noted. The remainder of the physical examination is unremarkable. Laboratory findings are significant for:
Total bilirubin 3.4 mg/dL
Prothrombin time 12 s
Aspartate transaminase (AST) 158 IU/L
Alanine transaminase (ALT) 1161 IU/L
Alkaline phosphatase 502 IU/L
Serum albumin 3.1 g/dL
Perinuclear antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies (p-ANCA) positive
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've noticed my eyes and skin turned yellow for the past week, I've been experiencing pain on the upper right side of my belly for a few days, I'm constantly tired, and I've suddenly started itching all over.

Thank you for sharing your symptoms with me. Based on what you've told me, I would like to ask a few more questions to help narrow down the possible causes of your symptoms.

I'm a 35-year-old man, and I don't have any allergies.

Have you recently traveled to any tropical or subtropical regions, or been exposed to any potential sources of parasites or infections?
No, I haven't traveled anywhere recently, especially not abroad.

Okay, that's helpful to know. Based on your symptoms, I would like to ask some questions about your medical history. Have you ever been diagnosed with any medical conditions, such as liver or kidney disease, or any other illnesses that could potentially cause your symptoms?

Can you tell me more about how your symptoms have been affecting you? For example, how severe is the abdominal pain, and how often do you experience it? And how much of your skin itching is causing discomfort?
The pain in my upper right belly has been there for the past few days, and the itching all over my body just started out of the blue and is really bothersome.

Thank you for providing more information. Based on what you've told me, I would like to ask some questions to help narrow down the possible causes of your symptoms.

The pain in my upper right belly is constant and the itching is severe; it feels like a general itching sensation all over.

Thank you for providing more information. Based on what you've told me, I would like to consider a few potential causes for your symptoms.

One possibility is that you may have an upper right quadrant abdominal inflammation or infection, such as a gallstone or a bacterial infection. The constant pain in this area could be caused by inflammation or irritation of the nearby tissues.

Another possibility is that you may have an allergic reaction or intolerance to something in your diet or environment. The itching could be a symptom of an allergic reaction, and the constant pain in the upper right quadrant could be a result of the inflammation caused by the allergy.

I would recommend that you schedule an appointment with your primary care physician or a gastroenterologist for further evaluation and diagnosis. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

My eyes and skin have turned yellow for the past week, I've been having pain on the right upper side of my stomach for a few days, I'm always tired, and I've started to itch all over my body very suddenly.

Thank you for sharing your symptoms with me. Based on what you've told me, I would like to ask a few more questions to help narrow down the possible causes of your symptoms.

Can you tell me your age and gender? Have you noticed any changes in your urine output or stool consistency? Have you experienced any recent travel or exposure to new foods or environments that could be contributing to your symptoms?
I'm a 35-year-old man, and no, I haven't noticed any changes in my urine or stool; I have also not traveled recently or been exposed to new foods or environments.

Great, thank you for letting me know. Based on your symptoms, I would like to ask some more questions to help determine the possible cause of your yellowing of the eyes and skin, as well as the abdominal pain.

Have you noticed any changes in your appetite or weight recently? Have you experienced any nausea or vomiting? Have you had any previous medical conditions, such as liver disease or gallstones?
I haven't noticed any changes in my appetite or weight, and I haven't had any nausea or vomiting. I've had a condition called ulcerative colitis for the past 2 years.

Thank you for letting me know about your medical history. Based on your symptoms and medical history, I would like to ask some more questions to help determine the possible cause of your yellowing of the eyes and skin, as well as the abdominal pain.

Have you experienced any recent changes in your medications or dosages? Have you noticed any changes in your bowel movements or stool consistency? Have you had any recent infections or illnesses?
No, I haven't had any changes in my medications or dosages, and I haven't noticed any changes in my bowel movements or stool. I haven't had any recent infections or illnesses either.

Great, thank you for letting me know. Based on your symptoms and medical history, I would like to consider the possibility of a liver condition.

Can you tell me if you have any history of excessive alcohol consumption or drug use? Have you noticed any darkening of the skin or eyes, particularly in the liver area? Have you experienced any abdominal swelling or discomfort?

I don't have a history of excessive alcohol consumption or drug use, and I haven't noticed any darkening of the skin or eyes, except for the yellowing. I do have pain in the right upper part of my abdomen, but no swelling.

Thank you for letting me know. Based on your symptoms, I would like to consider the possibility of a liver disease, such as primary biliary cirrhosis or primary sclerosing cholangitis. These conditions can cause yellowing of the skin and eyes, as well as abdominal pain in the right upper quadrant.

Can you tell me if you have any family history of liver disease or any other autoimmune disorders? Have you noticed any other symptoms, such as fatigue, loss of appetite, or joint pain?
I don't know of any family history of liver disease or other autoimmune disorders, but yes, I've been feeling constantly tired. I haven't had a loss of appetite or joint pain.

Great, thank you for letting me know. Based on your symptoms and medical history, I would like to recommend some further diagnostic tests to help determine the cause of your yellowing of the skin and eyes, as well as your fatigue.

I would like to schedule an appointment for you to have a liver function test, which will include a blood test to check your liver enzymes and a ultrasound to evaluate the liver size and texture. Additionally, I would like to schedule an appointment for you to have a CT scan of your abdomen to evaluate the bile ducts and liver for any signs of obstruction or inflammation.

Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns, and we can discuss the next steps in your evaluation.

Final diagnosis: Liver disease (primary biliary cirrhosis or primary sclerosing cholangitis)
